events.message: The insured filed a claim after their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following review of the incident details and keywords related to vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and serve as the primary contact for the claimant.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that their case would be processed promptly.
The agent requested a copy of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and official police report to support their case.
The claims investigation team commenced a thorough review of the incident, inspecting damage reports and verifying statements.
After evaluating all submissions and police findings, the investigation was completed with no discrepancies found.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the full repair costs and rental car expenses incurred by the claimant.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the responsiveness and transparency of the claims handling process.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the client.
The payment was processed and issued to the repair shop as well as the claimantâ€™s rental vehicle provider.
The claim was officially closed after all payments were settled and no further actions were required from the insured.
All claim files, correspondence, and settlement documents were securely archived for future reference.
